title: SlopismManifesto
description: Canonical structure for Slopism manifestos. 8 sections. Not all required — absence is data.

generation_disclosure.description: What role AI played in producing this manifesto. Slopism demands visible seams — this is the meta-seam.

sections.description: The eight canonical sections of a Slopism manifesto.

opening.description: The hook. The lines that stop someone mid-scroll or mid-wall. Short, declarative, rhythmic. No heading — it just hits. The manifesto lives or dies here.

naming.description: The claim on the word 'Slopist' — why we take the insult, what we make it mean. The emotional act of reclaiming a slur as identity. Not a definition — an act of ownership.

diagnosis.description: The problem stated. What has the machine done to making, to culture, to value? The condition — not the agent. This section carries the philosophical weight and earns the right to prescribe.

enemy.description: The antagonist, named. Distinct from the diagnosis: the diagnosis is the weather, the enemy is who profits from it. The sharper the enemy, the sharper the movement.

demands.description: The rules, imperatives, practices, and tests. What Slopism asks you to DO — and how you know if you did it. Manifestos without this section are essays.

lineage.description: Art-historical positioning. Who we descend from, who we reject, and what we add. Without it, the movement floats.

politics.description: The class and economic dimension. Who profits from the flood? Who drowns in it? A manifesto that ignores the political economy of AI content is aestheticizing a labor crisis. Absence is a statement.

closing.description: The final lines. The manifesto's last image, its mic-drop, its call to identity. No heading — it just lands. It should close like a door.

text.description: The manifesto content for this section.

notes.description: Editorial notes on intent, choices, or what could be stronger.
